solution.text:
\(\Delta_r G^\circleddash =\;- 2.303\;RT\;log K\). Note that T is in Kelvin.
\(\implies \Delta_r G^\circleddash =\;- 2.303 \times 8.314 \times _{temp}_ \times log (1 \times 10^{- _{ksup}_})\)
\(\implies \Delta_r G^\circleddash =\;_{{trunc(Decimal(2.303 * 8.314 * temp * ksup),2)}}_ \frac {J}{mol}\)

content.text: Calculate \(\Delta _r G^\circleddash\) for a given reaction \((A + _{k}_B \rightarrow C)\) at \(_{{temp-273.15}}_ ^{\circ} C\) given that the \(K_p\) is \(1 \times 10^ {-_{ksup}_}\)
